I still miss you - m4w

(google map) (yahoo map)

diet : asparagus

C,

It was about a year ago that we first met. We dated for a few months and then went our separate ways.

I know I was the one to cut things off, but I still struggle with that decision. Sometimes I think I made the right choice. But other times I wonder if there was more potential in you that I didn't see.

I broke things off because I felt like you weren't very mature in the ways that I wanted in a partner. You had trouble dealing with your temper, and sometimes when you got worked up it made me feel frustrated and lonely. You're amazing in so very many ways, but the woman I settle down with needs to have a good head on her shoulders. If you couldn't handle your temper for the small things that were outside of your control, what would you do about the big things? Why would I want to be go through life when someone who acted that way?

I know for sure I didn't give my heart time to feel okay with breaking things off. I felt pressure from myself to date other people in the city, and I felt pressure from you to make a decision about whether you would be the person I spent the rest of (or at least a great deal of) my life with. In retrospect, that pressure was probably imagined on my part, and this miscommunication is both of our faults.

So now I'm laying here and thinking of you, missing you. I wish I could see you and hear about your life now, but I don't know if you would even respond to my texts. If you agreed to meet me, it would hurt me to feel your coldness, and it would make me wallow in my melancholy and lack of closure. Maybe I didn't give you enough of a chance. Maybe it's something I have to do for myself, or maybe it's a step backwards.

But regardless, I wanted you to know that I miss you.

-****
